column1: 1 ^ Misericordiam et jūdicium cantābō tibi Domine. ^ Mercy and judgment I will sing to thee
2 ^ Psallem et intellegem in viā immaculātā
column2: quandō veniēs ad mē. Perambulābam in innocentiā cordis meī
column3: in mediō domūs meae. ^ I will sing and understand in the unspotted way
column4: when thou shalt come to me. I walked in the innocence of my heart
column5: in the midst of my house.

column1: 3 ^ Nōn prōpōnēbam ante oculōs meōs rem injūstam; facientēs praevāricātiōnēs ōdīvī. ^ I will not set before my eyes any unjust thing; I hated the workers of iniquities.
4 ^ Nōn adhaesit mihī cor prāvum; dēclīnantem ā mē malignum nōn cognōscēbam. ^ The perverse heart did not cleave to me
column2: and the malignant that turned aside from me I would not know.

column4: quum hōc nōn edēbam. ^ The man that in private detracted his neighbour
column5: him did I persecute; with him that had a proud eye

column2: ut sedeant mēcum; ambulans in viā immaculātā
column3: hic mihī ministrābat. ^ My eyes were upon the faithful of the earth
column4: to sit with me; the man that walked in the perfect way

column1: 7 ^ Nōn habitābit in mediō domūs meae quī facit superbiam; quī loquitur inīqua nōn dīrēxit in conspectū oculōrum meōrum. ^ He that worketh pride shall not dwell in the midst of my house; he that speaketh unjust things did not prosper before my eyes.
8 ^ In mātūtīnō interficiēbam omnēs peccātōrēs terrae
column2: ut disperderem dē cīvitāte Dominī omnēs operantēs inīquitātem. ^ In the morning I put to death all the wicked of the land
column3: that I might cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the Lord.
